messages.message:
For Split-Classify

1. When you are doing classify extract (whole doc becomes single class) or split-classify extract (a single doc can have multiple classes) - when doing first time - call the API like in the script below
https://github.com/instabase/benchmarks/blob/master/scripts/gemini_classify_extract.py

2. In Build, if you want to re-extract on a specific slice like when someone adds a field
You can do this by adding the whole PDF and adding to the prompt
```Only consider pages 2-3```
^ something like this
Seems to work reasonably well.

3. In app-run human review, if someone changes class, we want to re-extract
For this again, we can use the above logic where we pass the page number range to restrict the search

As long as page range is contiguous, this should work fine.

@pauline.comising can you take a look and list other edge cases that need to be addressed here?
One edge case, if it is a 1000 page doc and someone re-orders the document to have a record with all odd number pages, then the approach above will likely not work.
